name: bamalip
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: mpbi(wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)), wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w1, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wex(s0, w1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wex(s0, w1)

body.origin: |- wb(wex(s0, wa(w1, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w0))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, w2))
-| wex(s0, w1)

comment: "Bamalip", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ps ` is ` ch ` , and ` ph ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, AAI-4: PaM and MaS therefore SiP. Very similar to ~ barbari . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Shorten and reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
